item.title: All About SSH Keys
item.description: Jump to Updates What is SSH? Link to heading SSH, or Secure Shell, is a cryptographic network protocol used for secure communication between two computers over an unsecured network. It provides a secure channel over an insecure network by encrypting the data transmitted between the client and the server. SSH keys offer a more secure and convenient way to authenticate to remote servers compared to traditional password-based authentication. They are widely used in various scenarios, including server administration, file transfers, and remote command execution.
